info.document:
REUTERS LIVE SERVICE PLUS ADVISORY FOR GERMANY-ELECTION ON SUNDAY SEPTEMBER 24, 2017
(PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL PLANS ARE PROVISIONAL AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE)
    On Sunday September 24, Germany holds federal elections with Chancellor Angela Merkel seeking a fourth term in office.
    Merkel, who has been chancellor since 2005, is widely seen as Europe's most influential politician. She has weathered storms over mass immigration and financial and political turmoil in the European Union, while the SPD, Germany's oldest party has struggled to promote a strong rival.
    The SPD candidate, Martin Schulz's campaign got off to a promising start, but three crushing defeats at the hands of the conservatives in regional elections, including in its heartland of North Rhine-Westphalia, knocked him off course.
    The anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany party is expected to enter the national parliament for the first time.
FRIDAY SEPTEMBER 22
1230GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/SCHULZ NUREMBERG 
NUREMBERG - SPD Chancellor candidate Martin Schulz campaigns in Nuremberg
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
1230GMT 
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL HEPPENHEIM 
HEPPENHEIM - Chancellor Angela Merkel campaigns in Heppenheim
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
1500GMT 
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL ULM
ULM - German Chancellor Angela Merkel campaigns in Ulm
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
1700GMT 
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL MUNICH 
MUNICH - German Chancellor Angela Merkel holds her final campaign rally ahead of Sunday's vote. 
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
TIME TBC
GERMANY-ELECTION/SCHULZ RALLY
BERLIN - SPD chancellor candidate Martin Schulz holds a campaign rally as Germany prepares to go to the polls. (TBC)
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
**POSSIBLE ONLY / LIVE TBA**
TIME TBC
GERMANY-ELECTION-GREENS/
BERLIN - Leaders of Germany's Greens Party Cem Oezdemir and Katrin Goering-Eckardt final campaign rally in Berlin
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
TIME TBC
GERMANY-ELECTION/AFD RALLY
BRAUNSCHWEIG or BERLIN - AfD candidates Alexander Gauland and Alice Weidel are expected to hold a campaign rally as Germany prepares to go to the polls. 
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
SATURDAY SEPTEMBER 23
0900GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL RALLY
STRALSUND - German Chancellor Angela Merkel holds her final campaign rally ahead of Sunday's vote.
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
1030GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/SCHULZ RALLY
AACHEN - SPD chancellor candidate Martin Schulz holds his final campaign rally as Germany prepares to go to the polls. 
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
1100GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/LINDNER RALLY
DUSSELDORF - FPD chancellor candidate Christian Lindner holds his final campaign rally as Germany prepares to go to the polls. 
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
TIME TBC
GERMANY-ELECTION/AFD RALLY
LOCATION TBC - AfD candidates Alexander Gauland and Alice Weidel are expected to hold their final campaign rally as Germany prepares to go to the polls.
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
SUNDAY SEPTEMBER 24
0445-1630GMT 
GERMANY-ELECTION/BERLIN
BERLIN - View of the Reichstag, the German parliament building in Berlin as Germany goes to the polls. (0507GMT Sunrise)
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
0545-1600GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/POLLS OPEN-VOTING
BERLIN/WUERSELEN - Germany votes in federal election with polls opening at 0600gmt
Christian Democratic Union (CDU) candidate, German Chancellor Angela Merkel casts her vote in Belin (time tbc). 
Social Democrat Party candidate Martin Schulz casts his vote in Wurselen (time tbc).
Green Party joint candidate Cem Oezdemir casts his vote in Berlin (time tbc).  Katrin Goering-Eckardt has voted by post.
(Polls close 1600GMT)
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
1600-2200GMT 
GERMANY-ELECTION/EXIT POLLS-REACTIONS
BERLIN - The first exit polls are expected at 1600gmt. Reactions to these exit polls from the six main parties are expected to start shortly after 1600gmt. 
These live signals will be mixed into this one Reuters live event and will include: 
	Social Democrat Party candidate Martin Schulz and supporters reacting to the results at the Social Democratic Party headquarters; 
	CDU candidate Angela Merkel and supporters reacting to the results of the election at their party headquarters; 
	AfD supporters and candidates Alice Weidel and Alexander Gauland reacting to the election results; 
	FDP candidate Christian Lindner and supporters reacting to the election results at the party headquarters; 
	Green party candidates Cem Oezdemir and Katrin Goering-Eckardt and supporters reacting to the election results;
	Left-wing Linke party supporters and candidates Sahra Wagenknecht and Dietmar Bartsch reacting to the election results.
:: REUTERS / POOL (ACCESS ALL)
MONDAY SEPTEMBER 25
0445-1100GMT APPROX
GERMANY-ELECTION/BERLIN
BERLIN - View of Berlin as Germany awakes to a new government.
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
0700-1000GMT APPROX
GERMANY-ELECTION/REACTION
BERLIN - Leaders of the main German political parties react to the outcome of the election. 
CDU candidate Angela Merkel is expected to arrive at CDU headquarters at 0700gmt she will meet and greet party workers before holding a news conference. Reuters will also be live from SPD , AfD, FDP, Greens and left-wing party Linke to capture all reactions to the result and any comments on any possible coalition agreement.
:: REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
Regards
Reuters Video News LIVE Desk
If you have any LIVE planning coverage enquiries please contact our live desk 0900-2000GMT (Mon-Fri)
Phone: +44 20 7542 5849/4947
global-tv-rls@thomdonreuters.com
or our editorial support desk which is staffed 24 hours a day:
Phone: +44 20 7542 2244
tvnews@thomsonreuters.com
http://mediaexpress.reuters.com 
---------------------------------------
The contents of this email are confidential and may be read and used only by the individual or entity to which it is addressed.
-------------------------------
